2015 Silver Stamps

By Dear Cast & Crew

Mailed on December 22, 2015

Dear Readers,

Every week, we try to evaluate films from a slightly different slant than your average review site. And every year, we like to sharpen that perspective by awarding the less heralded achievements in cinema. The Silver Stamps are, therefore, not just a way to review the year that was, but the highest and lowest honours we can bestow. So for the fourth consecutive year, we congratulate all those who made an indelible mark in cinema.

Award For A Most Misleading Title: A Most Violent Year

Best STD Metaphor: It Follows

Best Sandwich Metaphor: What We Do In the Shadows

Best STD Sandwich Metaphor: Bang Gang

Freakiest Film: Going Clear: Scientology and the Science of Belief

Funniest Film Jupiter Ascending

Worst Physical Alteration of Johnny Depp Tie: Moustache, Mortdecai, Contact Lenses, Black Mass

Most Unexpected Tear-Jerker: Furious 7

Most Unexpected Crowd Pleaser: Straight Outta Compton

Most Distracting Breasts: Alexandra Diddario, San Andreas

Most Exciting Casting News: Alexandra Diddario, Baywatch (2016)

Best Road Trip Movie: The End of the Tour

Worst Road Trip Movie: Hot Pursuit

Best On-Screen Duo: Tom Hardy and Tom Hardy, Legend

Worst On-Screen Duo: Will Farrell and Kevin Hart, Get Hard

Best 7th Film of a Beloved, Decades-Old Franchise, Starring Original and New Cast Members: Tie: Creed and Star Wars: The Force Awakens

2nd Annual Jeff Bridges Award for Excellence in Bridgearian Acting: Jeff Bridges’ Voice in The Little Prince

Best Adaptation of the Frankenstein Story: Ex Machina

Worst Adaptation of the Frankenstein Story: Victor Frankenstein

Most Disturbing Sexual Content: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck

Least Disturbing Sexual Content: Fifty Shades of Grey

Hottest Robot: Alicia Vikander in Ex Machina

Hottest Spy: Alicia Vikander in The Man from U.N.C.L.E.

Hottest Danish Girl: Alicia Vikander in The Danish Girl

Best Looking Cast: The Man from U.N.C.L.E.

Best Sounding Cast: Inside Out

Most Unexpectedly Exciting Theatrical Event: Jurassic World

Most Unexpectedly Dull Theatrical Event: The Avengers: Age of Ultron

Worst Reimagining of a Fairy Tale Since Hook: Pan

Worst James Bond movie: Spectre

Best James Bond movie: Mission Impossible: Rogue Nation Spy

The 4th Annual Roger Deakins Award for Excellence in Being Roger Deakins – Roger Deakins for Sicario

The 1st Annual Hoyte Van Hoytema Award for Falling Short of Being Roger Deakins: Hoyte Van Hoytema for Spectre

The Jai Courtney Achievement in Ruining a Beloved Franchise: Terminator: Genisys

Best Everything: Mad Max: Fury Road

Worst Everything: Hot Tub Time Machine 2
